intro: Vismianthus sterculiifolius, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks in warmer regions.
